title: More efficient logic is needed to process disk sorting when there is a boundary value for row value
OB: When sorting on disk, if we sort a dataset of 40,000 rows and set the program to process only a subset of the data less than 40,000, the program performs the following operation:
EB: The program should implement a more efficient logic to handle disk sorting when there is a boundary value for the row value.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Sort a dataset of 40,000 rows on disk. 
2. Set the program to process a subset of the data less than 40,000 rows.
3. Observe the operation performed by the program and validate if it is efficient.
